intro: Chromatotriccum wentianum, commonly known as the Chinese starwort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in wetlands or along streams. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
